vectorData.altText:
18. The eyes blink reflexively in response to touch. Which cranial nerve is responsible for the sensory arm of this reflex?
Cranial nerve __#__, the ____________ nerve.(2 answers; separate with one space)

That's right!  Cranial nerve V, the trigeminal nerve, is responsible for general sensory innervation of the face. The ophthalmic division provide sensory innervation to the forehead, upper eyelid, the contents of the orbit and the tip of the nose.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

That took care of 8 of the 12 cranial nerves, three purely special sensory and five purely* voluntary motor; not so bad, so far! This leaves only four more nerves to introduce. Heres one more that is largely general sensory:
Cranial nerve V, the trigeminal nerve     , is sensory to the skin of the face. It consists of the ophthalmic (V1), maxillary (V2) and mandibular (V3) subdivisions. 
Read the following with reference to the figure.
Branches of the ophthalmic division, V1, (green) supply general sensory fibres to the forehead, the upper eyelid, the contents of the orbit and the tip of the nose, including portions of the nasal septum. 
Branches of the maxillary division, V2, (orange) supply sensory fibres to the skin of the lower eyelid, the side of the nose, both externally and internally, the upper cheek, the temple, the maxillary teeth, palate, and the upper lip.
Those of you who are, like me, a Gemini, recognize that trigeminal means triplets; the trigeminal nerve consists of three major subdivisions.

Branches of the mandibular division, V3, (blue) supply sensory fibres to the skin anterior to the ear, over the lower cheek, jaw, mandibular teeth, the floor of the mouth, the lower lip and chin.
The mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve is also motor to the muscles of mastication. These muscles move the jaw, allowing us to chew. A lesion of these motor branches of V3 causes weakness in these muscles; the jaw on attempted protrusion deviates toward the weakened side.
